results.title: As Afghan Refugee Crisis Unfolds, Survivors Recall ‘Miracle’ Evacuation
results.abstract: The U.S. military evacuated 91,000 people out of a North Korean port in 1950. By some estimates, it was the single largest wartime refugee evacuation in American history until Afghanistan.

results.title: As Kashmir Crackdown Endures, Poets Stifle Their Verses
results.abstract: Harsh measures against dissent have trickled down to practitioners of the region’s poetic traditions, with many saying they have been told to stop.

multimedia.caption: Ghulam Mohammad Bhat, who writes under the pen name Madhosh Balhami, reads and composes poetry in secret in Kashmir, sometimes by the banks of the Jhelum River.
multimedia.copyright: Showkat Nanda for The New York Times

results.title: Canadian health officials warn of an ‘urgent need’ to vaccinate young adults.
results.abstract: The call from Public Health Agency of Canada came as the highly contagious Delta variant has driven up cases and hospitalizations in recent weeks.

multimedia.caption: People sat in the observation area at a mass vaccination clinic in Toronto earlier this year. Those aged 18 to 39 are a lagging demographic in the country’s vaccination rate.
multimedia.copyright: Cole Burston/The Canadian Press, via Associated Press
